references.paper_title: Open-ended instructable embodied agents with memory-augmented large language models
references.reason: This paper introduces the core methodology of memory-augmented large language models for embodied agents, a concept central to ICAL's functionality.

references.paper_title: Teach: Task-driven embodied agents that chat
references.reason: This paper introduces the TEACh benchmark, one of the main datasets used to evaluate ICAL's performance.

references.paper_title: VisualWebArena: Evaluating multimodal agents on realistic visual web tasks
references.reason: This paper introduces the VisualWebArena benchmark, another main dataset used for ICAL's performance evaluation.

references.paper_title: Ego4D: Around the world in 3,000 hours of egocentric video
references.reason: This paper introduces the Ego4D dataset, providing a foundation for ICAL's action anticipation experiments.

references.paper_title: A reduction of imitation learning and structured prediction to no-regret online learning
references.reason: This paper introduces the DAgger algorithm, which serves as a conceptual basis for the human-in-the-loop aspect of ICAL.
